cicognara-catalogo.title: Structmapping needs more specific headers for individual sections

comments.body: Right. I believe that Esmé has shown me how to do this a loooonnnnng time ago but I don't remember how to. @escowles and @tpendragon -- Can you remember/ give us an idiot's guide to doing this?

There's a bug here I didn't know about. It should be that if you remove the source metadata identifier and then set the title it should use that title, but it doesn't work. Please see https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/issues/3818. I've attached the issue to our current sprint, so hopefully we can get this dealt with soon.

figgy.title: Viewer for groups of objects linked to a single finding aid component

comments.body: This is related to the automatic EAD linking process, since that takes each complete object that is linked to a finding aid component and adds the DAO link. Maybe this should work like the Orangelight lookup based on bib number? Or maybe we could make an endpoint similar to the ARK-based one that would give you a manifest or collection of manifests based on how many matches there were?

pulfalight.title: Homepage Redesign

comments.body: Certain portions of the redesign are *not* going to be scoped as MVP for this. They still need to be identified.

"Recent Updates" and "Digital Content" would need to be automated, but may not be considered MVP. However, "Location and Hours" and "Request Materials" really should be MVP.

What does automation mean for each of these content blocks? Is there a pool of content for "Digital Content" which is sampled for the most recently digitized content? If there are descriptions, where are these pulled from?

There were <dao> thumbnails which were used on PULFA 2.0, where thumbnail images were featured for collections if they were present.

Using this approach could provide a mechanism for determining how to readily showcase digital content with the thumbnails present.

PULFALight should be notified of newly-added digital content for Figgy, with the carousel interface for the "Digital Content" updated with the new thumbnail. Figgy thumbnails can be associated with digitized content - what needs to be investigated is how this would be supported with the underlying data models for Figgy.

The "Locations and Hours" data is already available, and the "Request Materials" can be approached for the MVP. The main search bar must remain prioritized for the MVP.

However, what are the boundaries for these two content blocks? Are we strictly reproducing existing functionality for the existing PULFA 2.0 site?

There may need to be a further conversation regarding these requirements, and incrementally enhancing the "Recent Updates" and "Digital Content" blocks should be considered.

It should also be noted that archival collections has a script which aggregates the links for Figgy content, and insert these as <dao> elements into existing Finding Aid EADs. Hence, some of the automation has already been supported.
